monogr.title: Two sermons : viz. 1. A preseruatiue lilie to cure soules. And 2. How to seeke to finde Christ. Preached by that famous and iudicious diuine, Peter Lilie, Doctor of Diuinitie, and sometime fellow of Iesus Colledge in Cambridge
monogr.author: Lily, Peter

div.head: Maria Lily moesta Authoris filia, haec secum maerens meditata est.

lg.l: I Ioy that I haue found him whom I lost,
Whose death so many teares mine eies hath cost;
I lost a Father, but haue found him be,
A Father to the Church, as well as me:
The Church yet calls him Father, so will I,
His Workes doe liue, and he shall neuer die.

lg.head: Aliud eiusdem.
lg.l: I Grieue that I haue lost him, whom I had,
Life of my life, who so my soule did glad:
But doe I grieue, or am I rather glad,
That such a peerelesse Father once I had?
Yet doe I grieue, and yet againe am glad,
That I shall finde in heau'n him, whom I had.
